page.title: 19The Royal Military Academy
page.content:
In 1812 the army bought some land in Sandhurst on which they built the Sandhurst Royal Military Academy. The site covers about 1000 acres to the north of the A30. It was originally {scrubby moor and heath land}owned by Parliament, with a house at the bottom of the grounds called Parliament House.
The army uses Sandhurst to train its {officer cadets}and they are a familiar sight around town, dressed in off-duty grey flannels and sports jackets.
The Staff College (for senior ranks) is on the same site and many foreign armies send their top men to train there, creating a small but noticeable transient foreign population because most bring their wives (in some cases several) and families with them.
